website_summaries.verdict: Despite some durability and longevity concerns, this tent offers several impressive features and 126 sq. ft. of space that will accommodate numerous members of the family.
pros: Has a handy room divider that adds a bit of privacy
Ground and ceiling vents work together to keep air flowing
Owners are impressed with how easy it is to set up
Maximum center height is 78 inches
Comes with a rain fly
cons: Materials aren't as durable as those of competitors on our list, especially the mesh components that come apart easily

website_summaries.verdict: A roomy, sturdy, and dry tent that can be set up in less than a minute. Double doors are great for high-traffic entry and exit.
pros: Impressive 60-second setup and takedown, even with the optional room divider and rainfly
Stays dry in light to medium levels of rain and is well-ventilated
Stands up to windstorms
Double door is a nice plus
cons: Not all window liners have tie-up seams
Tent stakes are too lightweight, so users may want to replace with sturdier stakes

website_summaries.verdict: A large, well-built tent that even a novice camper will feel comfortable setting up and taking down.
pros: Goes up and comes down quickly and easily
Fits 2 queen air mattresses
Good ventilation keeps tent from getting stuffy
Large bag is easy to fit the tent back into
Double door for convenience
Electrical cord access port
cons: Too large and heavy to be used for backpacking trips

website_summaries.verdict: This is essentially a traditional family tent with the bonus of instant set-up. We like the roominess, the extended ceiling height, and overall stability in challenging weather conditions. Worth the higher initial investment.
pros: 60 second set-up time
Weatherproof shell promotes water beading
Ventilation system draws in cool air and expels warm air
Can be divided into two rooms
Electrical port and storage pockets included
78 inch ceiling clearance
cons: Some users report damage (holes) upon arrival
Zippers may not be as durable as the rest of the tent

website_summaries.verdict: In spite of some quality issues, it's worth considering if you need an extremely spacious, easy to set up tent.
pros: Tops our list for the most spacious model we considered that is also easy to set up and take down
Fits up to 9 people and can be assembled in 60 seconds
Has a room divider and carrying bag
cons: While its size is a plus for some, it's not practical for all users
Some durability concerns have been reported – thin material, subpar zippers, leaks

customer_reviews.title: This tent requires zero profanity
customer_reviews.text: Just buy this tent. It went up in under 90 seconds by myself. The poles are attached already and you simply take it out of the box and pull up. It also went back in the bag with zero effort and profanity. This is the perfect car camping tent.
customer_reviews.author: CW

customer_reviews.title: Broke immediately
customer_reviews.text: We were excited to receive this tent the day before our camping trip, and we set it up in our living room just to make sure all was in order. Unfortunately, it wasn't. One of the poles was twisted to where the lower part of the leg was on top of the upper part, and when we straightened it the pole literally split. We tried to hold it in place while we set up the rest of the tent so we could see how we liked it, and it broke completely in half. I'm sure ours was defective, but altogether a very disappointing experience. I guess we are using our old tent again this year!
customer_reviews.author: Amber June

customer_reviews.title: DON'T GET SCAMMED - Buy it and hope it doesnt break
customer_reviews.text: I love the ease and size of this tent. We bought in june 26 2018, stored in overhead garage location, used it 2 times, and this year for memorial day we found a tent post splitting. Perfect split like a MFG defect not a break. I've contacted the company Core and gotten no response. Emailed amazon twice no response. The tent is useless now, and were out 200$ for 2 uses.
customer_reviews.author: R Brandt

customer_reviews.title: Holes in roof and floor.
customer_reviews.text: First trip: opened up the tent and it had a hole in the ceiling mesh and in the floor. Luckily we had duct tape and could seal the mesh up top to avoid the mosquitos. Had a tarp underneath, too. Luckily it didn’t rain on the trip, because I think our floor would’ve gotten wet. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: william jack

customer_reviews.title: Poles are weak and break easy
customer_reviews.text: Ordered tent at the start of summer in anticipation of summer camping trip. Took the tent out first night of camping and attempted to put up and multiple poles snapped. Because I ordered at the beginning of summer afraid I wouldn't be able to find a good quality one I am now unable to return this broken tent. I am now out $200 for this tent and had to she'll out another $140 for a different tent. And I had to explain to a 9 year old why we couldn't camp with a broken tent.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Russell

customer_reviews.title: Great tent for my family vacation
customer_reviews.text: Spent 7 nights in Yellowstone (single dad and four kids under 14). It was just the right size, and I was able to put it up in a matter of minutes with the help of my 12 year-old daughter. The umbrella design was awesome. It rained 5 nights we were there and we got no leaks. Taking it down was a little harder than putting it up because we couldn't remember how to fold the poles at the elbow joints. But it fit back into its original bag!
customer_reviews.author: Hooked on Books

customer_reviews.title: GARBAGE TENT
customer_reviews.text: This text is extremely poorly built. I took it out only 1 time this summer and it already has almost 10 holes in it. Fabric is super cheap and tears without much friction. I wouldn't recommend this to anyone, rather spend a little more for name brand materials and a lifetime warranty like with REI. If the seller wants to refund me I'd be impressed and update my review to 5 stars after my refund.
customer_reviews.author: Clyde Klotz IV

customer_reviews.title: Joint broke while testing setup
customer_reviews.text: We tested this tent in our backyard tonight. It went up very easily, and we were happy. Then, while collapsing it, one of the poles snapped at the joint, rendering the tent unusable. We weren't applying unreasonable force; I would call the situation "normal usage". We're returning the tent and fortunately have a couple of weeks left before our real trip to replace it.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Mendez

customer_reviews.title: Great easy large waterproof and sturdy tent.
customer_reviews.text: We are by far not expert campers. In fact this was our first time as a family camping. I’ve done it a fair amount of times when I was younger with the old school tents and let me tell you this tent is by far the easiest set up I have ever seen. I pretty much put the whole tent up by myself and took it down by myself. It poured while we were sleeping so I can actually confirm it’s waterproof. I’m happy we got this tent and everything worked out.
customer_reviews.author: dru1313

customer_reviews.title: Great large tent!  Should stand up to any in this price range and beyond!
customer_reviews.text: Wow! Big tent to say the least! Easy setup and take down though. Included stuff sack is large enough yo fit tent without much trouble. Tentbis heavy. Around 40 pounds I would think. Great quality material. We used tarps underneath and on top of interior floor. Nice ventilation. Overall a great tent!
customer_reviews.author: Alicia MTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: So easy to assemble!!!
customer_reviews.text: My 12 year old and I like to camp but were feeling cramped in a 3 person tent. We needed something we could put a small table and chairs in for rainy days, but it also had to be something we could assemble. We bought the 9 person instant cabin tent. At 5'4" and 4'7" we were able to put it up in about 5 minutes. We would never have been able to put a conventional tent up. The tent we bought had a hole in a seam. Customer service was amazing. We had a new tent within a week. Aside from being easy to assemble, there are ample windows, and additional side vents for excellent air flow.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Set up time is enough reason to buy
customer_reviews.text: This thing is the best tent I've ever seen! Set up took less than 4 minutes, tear down maybe 6?! Amazing!! The features for ventilation, windows, vents and roof were perfect!! Got the 9 person tent and for a family of 4 (2 toddlers) was perfect size!! Enough room for everything, including a portable potty in the corner. But seriously, effortless set up and tear down gets this tent a 6 stars if there was such rating! Everything seems and feels like great materials and finishes. Sturdy. Can't recommend this tent enough!
customer_reviews.author: Diego Bernal

customer_reviews.title: The Big Bad wolf can blow this down
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed. The three little pigs are going to get away because the wolf blew this tent down. In the middle of setting it up for the first time it broke. the wind was blowing about 15 miles per hour but this thing works like a sail. and the 3 main supports would not hold. after working with it for about 30 minutes one of the poles just ripped out of the supports. Not even duct tape can fix it. Bottom line don't waste your money on this junk.
customer_reviews.author: Frank Z.

customer_reviews.title: Storage bag is C__p! - get this bag instead.
customer_reviews.text: Update - so previously I said the tent was great and 1 person could set it up and take down. The storage bag on the other hand was TOTAL cap. The zipper blew out the first time I tried to put the tent back in. I got this new bag yesterday and it is a perfect size for the tent. Heavy canvass fabric and heavy duty zipper - highly reccomnd this bag for the tent.
customer_reviews.author: Guddaddy

customer_reviews.title: Ridiculously easy to put up.
customer_reviews.text: I'm 5' tall, in my 50's with health issues and camping has to be easy now. I decided to try this so I could do more camping again. I was actually able to put this up the first time I tried. It took only 20 minutes with help only for the fly due to wind. Next time I'll put the fly on earlier. I took it down and folded it properly in about 5 minutes. Extremely heavy dew (100% humidity) Did wick in at night if I touched the walls so I a going to scotchguard it. Other than that, I love it.
customer_reviews.author: A.  Krupa

customer_reviews.title: Easy up and kept the rain out!
customer_reviews.text: Used this on our weekend camping trip and we were very happy! It started with an extremely easy-up experience. It took one person five minutes or so to have our tent up and ready. While away from our site partaking in activities on the campground, we had a torrential downpour and when returning to our site, the inside was dry! No leaks whatsoever, despite the puddles of rain and mud that surrounded our tent. Loved the two separate entry doors, as well as the ample amount of space to spread out into inside. Would definitely recommend this to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Holly Van Allen

customer_reviews.title: Easy to set up and plenty of room!
customer_reviews.text: Single mom here with small children and I love this tent. I can set it up and take down by myself. It takes me more like 10 minutes with the rain fly and tent stakes but still the easiest tent I have ever put up. The two rooms are nice although this tent if for 3 people and a dog I couldn't imagine getting more than 5-6 comfortably. Rained on us most of the night and I had no water in my tent. Was super easy to take down and fits nicely in the bag. No shoving or sitting on of half zipping. This TENT is a 10!
customer_reviews.author: BRIGMANDA

customer_reviews.title: SO EASY!!!
customer_reviews.text: So glad I went with this tent! It took me about 2 minutes to put it up and take down is just as easy. For those saying that it will never fit back in the bag, after you've taken the tent down roll it up tight in the rain fly and I had no problem getting it back in the bag. It easily fit 2 queen air mattresses for me and my 3 kiddos and 2 large dog beds for our golden retrievers with room to spare for some gear. I can't testify to the water proof quality as it did not rain on our trip but overall this tent is amazing.
customer_reviews.author: MeganM

customer_reviews.title: Great Space
customer_reviews.text: The size of this tent is great! Plenty of room for 2 adults, 2 kids, and all the gear. Opening the front of the tent fully is useful when loading gear and lots of entering and exiting. Useful to have the side door too. Love all the air flow features of the tent. There is a middle curtain that is detachable. The downside to the curtain is that it connects with hooks and ties on the top and sides--the bottom is not attached to the tent so it can move quite a bit with the breeze. Overall, love the tent!
customer_reviews.author: Tyler J. Seader

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Tent
customer_reviews.text: This tent is amazing! Very good quality, and easy set up. We've had it out several times now. Last night, it was at a campground during a very heavy rain storm with high winds. The storm caused other tents in the group to leak and many people to leave or sleep in their cars, but we were cozy and dry in this tent with no problems. I would definitely buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Prime Customer

customer_reviews.title: The negative reviews are important.
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately, the negative reviews are right on this one. Within 5 hours of this tent being setup by 3 experienced campers, one of the poles of the tent snapped from the tiniest gust of wind. This low level of durability is unacceptable in a product meant for the outdoors. If you plan to use this indoors for some reason it’s probably a great tent.
customer_reviews.author: Max E.

customer_reviews.title: Works in San Francisco!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this tent to move to San Francisco to try out the new homeless trend. Very good tent! Seems to stop the rats from getting in so far. However the smell permeates through the screen venting system. It’s definitely water proof because I’ve had many drunk neighbors pee on it and have never gotten wet. Totes would buy again. Btw. The homeless trend is as much fun as you read about. Sure you’re free to do whatever all day but it can get a little extreme at times.
customer_reviews.author: Diggler

customer_reviews.title: Total Disappointment
customer_reviews.text: I was looking forward to camping with this after returning a Coleman tent which proved to be garbage and leak like a sive when wet. This tent went up nicely however being that the stakes are so tiny they don't hold the tent in place adequately in 20 mph winds. I've attached a before and after wind photo. I came back to my campsite after fishing for an hour and my tent had been totally blown down. Stakes were pulled from the ground and the only thing holding my tent down was all of my belongings inside.
customer_reviews.author: Troy Teixeira

customer_reviews.title: Ruined our whole weekend -_-
customer_reviews.text: Was hopeful based on reviews, but returned via full refund from amazon. The set up was great- our first night it rained (a lot I will say), and the tent was leaking soaking our mattresses and bedding/ things on the ground which wouldn’t dry out for the next few days. If it was weatherproof it would’ve been amazing (we even bought a heavy duty tarp), but for the huge inconvenience it caused, we couldn’t overlook it and returned.
customer_reviews.author: Sarahw285

customer_reviews.title: Not a Waterproof tent
customer_reviews.text: We bought this tent because it had good reviews and looked like something that let our camping needs. The tent is easy to put up and take down. I wouldn’t say it’s easy to do alone but with a few people you can definitely put it up/down in a few minutes. However the material is very thin and not durable at all and the tent is not waterproof. After a light rain we were soaked. Water dripped in through the seems and came in through the top cover. The zippers got caught really easily in the lining. I would not recommend this tent for anyone who lives in a place that gets regular rain in the summer camping season.
customer_reviews.author: Teresa Oberti

customer_reviews.title: Broke within 10 seconds.
customer_reviews.text: Was discouraged when this tent was put to use, considering all the wonderful reviews. Of course there is a chance that we just happened to receive a defective one. The moment we went to put up the tent, the center string snapped, subsequently causing the rest of the set up to be unsuccessful. In total 3 straps broke during initial set up. It seemed as if the tent was too small for the frame. Luckily we are frequent campers and brought our back up tent. But I highly encourage pre set up at home before going out to camp. The return process has been a breeze but unfortunately we will be going with a different tent.
customer_reviews.author: A. Nunn

customer_reviews.title: Up in 60 seconds & very roomy for four people
customer_reviews.text: It's easy to see why this tent is so popular - up in or down in one minute, well-made & very roomy for four people. The included interior divider is great, so it feels like two separate tents. The only improvement suggestion I have is to either move one "door" to the left side of the tent or add a third "door". The two doors are next to each other on the right side of the tent. People on the left side of the tent need to open the partition and exit through the right side - potentially disturbing other tent occupants. A separate entrance/exit on the left side would be welcome. Great tent.
customer_reviews.author: CriticalEye

customer_reviews.title: Great Tent with Fast Set Up
customer_reviews.text: We got this for my son for his birthday since he just joined cub scouts. He LOVES it! It was such a simple set up. It does take two people, but it takes less than 2 minutes to set up. I'd definitely get a tarp to but beneath it to keep the floor in good condition. We could feel the stickers in the grass beneath it, so I want to get something fairly thick before we go out again. Our kids love it, and it's huge! I'd definitely suggest it to friends.
customer_reviews.author: D. Robertson

customer_reviews.title: Huge and stupid-easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: This tent lived up to the instant setup. I set it up by myself in minutes. The rain fly took more time to put on than the tent itself because I did it after the tent was already up. This thing had enough room for a queen sized raised air mattress on one side, and all or bags/clothes on the other. the large side air vents make this great for summer camping, probably less than ideal in winter. Putting it away is simple but a little awkward, but all in all, way better than messing with separate poles.
customer_reviews.author: Standoffish Dan

customer_reviews.title: Multiple Leaks
customer_reviews.text: The tent was very easy to setup and take down which is why I gave it 2 stars instead of one. But after an afternoon of constant light rain it leaked in two spots, both where the wall storage pockets were. The seams were taped but somehow it still leaked and I'm glad it wasn't a heavy rain. I was sure if anything, the tent would leak where the 3 zippers meet in an odd way on the end door but that stayed dry. I am returning the tent because I cannot have one that leaks, I camp in all kinds of weather and heavy rain doesn't deter me so that's a deal breaker.
customer_reviews.author: Keone

customer_reviews.title: Very happy camper
customer_reviews.text: Love this tent! Family of 4 (two small kids) and it was the perfect amount of room for our 3 night trip. We upgraded from a 6 person tent to this and couldn’t be happier. It rained overnight one night and everything stayed dry (without extra sealing on our part). Beautiful with a few twinkle lights and outdoor rugs. We all squeezed into a Queen blow up bed, giving us plenty of storage space, but could easily fit two more sleeping bags without space concerns. Looking forward to our next trip.
customer_reviews.author: KrisSquared

customer_reviews.title: Best tent ever!!
customer_reviews.text: I brought this tent to Rock Fest 2019 and we had some bad stormy weather. This tent was flipped over, legs up on the air flapping around like it was a hurricane outside. We were all watching from the safety of the truck and thought it was done for. After the storm I was able to just to untangle and pop the frame back up. The tent was soaked but that is because the canopy blew off. I am surprised the tent made it through that. Many other campsites and tents did not survive that storm. I am so impressed with the tent. If I could give it more stars I would.
customer_reviews.author: Savannah

customer_reviews.title: Overall, great design!
customer_reviews.text: We have only used the tent one time, but we loved how easy it was to set up and take down. We fit three twin air mattresses in the tent with room to spare. The mesh top of the tent kept the tent cooler during the day and dryer in the morning. The mesh in the windows and at the top kept the smallest of ants out of the tent. The rain tarp kept the tent sheltered against the sun and light rain. I am not sure how durable the tent would be agains strong winds and a lot of rain. Overall, great design!
customer_reviews.author: mother and teacher

customer_reviews.title: Easy set up!
customer_reviews.text: Nice roomy tent, the ease of set up is amazing. Camped at a motorcycle rally for a week, we had our double-tall queen air mattress, two large duffle bags, assorted rally supplies, all our bike gear (helmets, boots, etc.), a folding chair (I need a chair for dressing - don't judge me!) and room to stand up! The nylon is sturdy, and held up to a couple pretty windy days, but it is thin. We had to put a tarp up on one side to block the campground streetlight. Nice that there are 2 doors, but I'd have put them a bit farther apart, instead of on adjoining walls. Still: great tent, glad we got it!
customer_reviews.author: Marie

customer_reviews.title: I Love This Tent!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this tent last summer. The first outing we endured a massive thunderstorm with torrential downpours. We stayed completely dry inside despite water flowing under our tent! Just 2 days ago we were camping at 6400 feet. The wind picked up and blew all night with sideways rain. Must have been 40 mph winds. We thought for sure that there would be damage come morning but NO! The set up and take down are incredibly quick and easy.
customer_reviews.author: Dana Richardson

customer_reviews.title: Worthless after one trip
customer_reviews.text: After using this tent on one camping trip one of the poles has broken off (see pictures). It was not windy on our trip, and the tent did not suffer any trauma. Just put it up and took it down per the directions. Set it up this evening to take on our next camping trip, and this damage was found. Unfortunately outside of the return window, so this was an expensive one trip tent.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Beyond happy with this purchase
customer_reviews.text: LOVE LOVE LOVE this tent. It was a surprise for my kiddo (indoor camping), and wow, it's larger than I imagined. Great quality and everything came new and in perfect condition. Easy to assemble (once you figure out what you're doing) - quick. Spacious and the mesh protects you. Love the ability to hang the lantern on the top (as pictured). Kiddo is in love with the tent. It's a great idea for actual camping, backyard camping, or indoor camping (but wow, it takes up a lot of room)! Something fun to do for kiddos during the pandemic.
customer_reviews.author: CC✨👩🏻‍🍳✨

customer_reviews.title: Great tent for the amateur outdoorsman!
customer_reviews.text: Can't say enough about this tent! Incredibly easy to set up (<5 minutes), sharp look, weather proofing works. Just went camping with the inlaws and my FIL was setting up his tent next to ours. We had ours up before he even had his laid out, and then a storm rolled in. Poor guy had to stop mid-set up to let the storm pass while I huddled with everyone in my tent listening to the rain hit the roof, while not a drop entered the tent. Buy it without reservation. Its worth it!
customer_reviews.author: Chamtrain

customer_reviews.title: Ease of setup: 100%!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this in December, primarily for a camp I’m attending in July. I set it up in the yard today as practice, and my husband was lurking nearby because he was pretty sure I was going to run into problems and need help. Surprise! I didn’t. It went up easily in a very few minutes. The one thing I should have done is put the rain fly on BEFORE extending the poles. Otherwise: easy peasy!
customer_reviews.author: J.K.

customer_reviews.title: Worked perfectly at first, broke in the wind after 2nd use.
customer_reviews.text: Tent worked great first two times, little to no problem setting it up (I’ve never done anything like this before). No longer works, beams broke and falls apart in wind. Not satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Chloe

customer_reviews.title: No rainfly!!!
customer_reviews.text: This tent did not come with rain fly. It appears in the pictures AND in the directions with the tent that the rain fly is "step 4". We did NOT get one. Spending $200 on a tent i would think it had a rainfly!! Very disappointed as it rained when we were camping. Ugh!! UPDATE:: amazon was awesome and replaced our tent! We were lucky enough to be with a group of people who had an extra rainfly so no harm done!!
customer_reviews.author: Nichole Tuten

customer_reviews.title: Very Nice, Great Buy
customer_reviews.text: The one issue I have with this tent is the vent system at the bottom of the sides. In cooler weather, there is no positive way to close it up. There is one drawstring to pull and hold shut a roughly three foot section. Other than that - excellent fit and finish / adequate carry bag, IT FITS! / sets up quickly with zero experience / breaks down quickly and packs with zero experience, as compared to a comparable sized tent. Love the open porch screen room feel of the main entry side. Light for its size. As always, the stakes it comes with are terrible, but no one provides good stakes.
customer_reviews.author: Mad_Garden_Gnome

customer_reviews.title: Great fort in basement for my son!
customer_reviews.text: Christmas present...a fort hangout ...for my 10 yr old in our unfinished basement. I have zero skills in setting a tent up. This took me less than 5 mins BY MYSELF! All I did was telescope the poles which are already on the tent and it popped up itself. My son was so happy on Xmas - he put an old mattress in it, beanbag chair, blankets. Perfect place for a friend sleepover and a kid hang out. This was one of my favorite purchases ever. I’m so glad I bought it for him. What a great tent!!
customer_reviews.author: MCfromCT

customer_reviews.title: Best tent I have ever owned.
customer_reviews.text: I don't write reviews, but this tent gets one! Goes up and down and into a bag in under 5min! No messing w/ stupid poles etc. Had gnarly windstorm and it held up perfect. I did buy "real" stakes to stake it down as any that come with anything are garbage. Other than that, perfect tent with plenty of headroom. I'm 5'6". Very nice tent for the price. I'd pay $450 for it honestly.
customer_reviews.author: steve

customer_reviews.title: Great camping tent
customer_reviews.text: Took this on a week long raft trip. The setup up is ridiculously easy. Well made, seems durable. Not as wind resistant as traditional dome tents, and I've had to tie the posts to neighboring trees for a secure night's sleep in high wind, but that's a trade off for uber-easy setup. Update July 2020 Seam ripped in one spot on the ceiling where the hook attaches to the top support poles. Overall, still quite satisfied. With stood huge wind if adequately lashed down.
customer_reviews.author: Marty Z

customer_reviews.title: Great roomy tent with awesome ventilation and lots of windows!
customer_reviews.text: This tent worked perfectly for my husband and our two large dogs. We wanted a bigger tent, as we now bring along camping cots, and toted along our two big dogs. We needed enough room for all of us, and wanted a tent we could stand up in as well. This was perfect. We loved all the windows and ventilation places. We were comfortable temperature-wise, and had plenty of space for everyone. It was very easy to set up, I was able to set it up mostly by myself while hubby unloaded other things. The bag given has plenty of room for take down and packing everything up. Great purchase, we're thrilled with our new tent!
customer_reviews.author: Aly

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic
customer_reviews.text: I spent hours researching tents before settling on this one. It did not disappoint. Very easy and fast to put up AND quick takedown. No problems with any water leaks. The bag it comes with is plenty big so you don't go crazy trying to put it away. Ventilation is awesome! We have a California King size air mattress and still had plenty of room for a cot + walking space. The stakes are the only thing that I had to order separately - this comes with the flimsy typical tent stakes but those are inexpensive to upgrade. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Law

customer_reviews.title: It's a Good tent for the $$$
customer_reviews.text: I typically don't give 5 stars for anything because that means there's nothing to improve on. I'm impressed with this tent. It's big and bulky to try to carry outside the carry bag but it's very roomy and easy to set up and take down with just one person. It has a lot of windows which allows for good sure movement. Haven't had it in inclimate weather but I've scotch guarded the tent and fly and look forward to getting a lot of use out of it. Just wish the zippers felt a little beefier
customer_reviews.author: Stix577

customer_reviews.title: Love this tent! Very roomy and Water resistant!
customer_reviews.text: We absolutely love our tent! It’s the perfect size for both of us and to have room to move around as well. We had a hard rain storm during our trip and had no problems with leaks, came back to our tent all dry inside with dry walls. Would highly recommend this tent to anyone. It got chilly during the night so we tightened the vents at the bottom and it kept us warm. Can’t wait to use it again!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Storm proven and easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: This tent has now survived 2 thunderstorms with gusts of wind strong enough to knock over two trees in the campground. Mind you, the wind blew those walls in pretty hard, but it stood! Our only pet peeve is that the zipper gets caught on the rain flaps. It's annoying. Otherwise it is as easy to set up as it looks!
customer_reviews.author: Annibell

customer_reviews.title: Just as advertised.  It is a great tent!
customer_reviews.text: As advertised. This tent sets up in a breeze. I am not a camper, but a close friend has a number of families over every year at his place to camp on his property. This tent was up in just a few minutes, without any help. Super spacious and I can stand up straight throughout most of the tent (I am six feet tall). It comfortably slept me, my wife and five young kids. I have only used it once, but would definitely recommend this tent to anyone looking for a larger tent for a good price. There were no quality issues and I was able to get the tent back in the back, with other supplies fairly easily.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect
customer_reviews.text: My husband is an engineer and really loves this Tent, which should tell you a lot about how well designed it is. It was fast to put up and take down, but the best part of it is being able to fall asleep staring at the stars, through the screen roof. Plus- amazing airflow with so many screened windows and doors. The only drawback so far is that a zipper on one of the windows broke the first time we used it (this weekend). It came off the track and we can’t get it back on. Bummer because my return window expired. Otherwise we love this thing.
customer_reviews.author: AMC in ATL

customer_reviews.title: Nice tent, but room for improvement.
customer_reviews.text: I havent been camping with it yet, but I set it up and tore it down 3 times. Goes up, and comes down very very easily! I dont know if i will like the lower "vents" seems it would have velcro or something to keep it closed when not in use. The room divider is basically see through if there's any type of light and has gaps around the edges, so that's kind of useless for privacy. So far seems like a nice tent, but there is definitely room for improvement
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Awesome tent!  Sets up and comes down in a flash!
customer_reviews.text: Wow! This tent is AWESOME! We camped as a family of 5, and had space for a queen bed, and three twin mattresses. The first night it rained, and not a drop got into the tent. The second night we were able to take the cover off and sleep under the stars. My husband didn’t believe me whe I said it would be set up in minutes, but it was up and ready in less than 2! This tent also came back down effortlessly! I would highly recommend it to anyone!
customer_reviews.author: Kristen Quitno

customer_reviews.title: Easy to set up and take down and held up through storms and hail without a single leak!
customer_reviews.text: My wife and I took this out camping and it was super easy to set up. Unfortunately it rained every single day we were camping but this tent held up great. Not a single leak. We even had hail at one point and it held up just fine. I would highly recommend this tent to anyone who hates setting up normal tents. Putting up and taking this tent down was super quick and simple.
customer_reviews.author: LP

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: I researched Tents for 3 months before choosing this one. I have never set up a tent nor stayed in one so i was nervous buying one. This tent is great! IT'S HUGE!!! We put it on our 6 foot trailer and had to squeeze it on there. It withstood the wind and rain!! we set it up at the house before taking it on our ride and I set it up and took it down by my self and it took me 5 min. The only thing is there was a hole in the top mesh part but the rain fly Prevented water coming in. We can't wait to take it on our camping trip!
customer_reviews.author: Kristopher Fontenot

customer_reviews.title: Easy Setup/take down
customer_reviews.text: Used this tent for a family camping trip. Was so easy to set up! Lots of room inside. Grandkids wanted to sleep in it! They called it my" lil house". We had a 22" high queen size air mattress in it, our clothes and could put our camp chairs inside at nightI! With room to change and move. It didnt rain, so cannot comment on water resistance. Will say, that never saw any morning dew on the tent. Take down was related to a "pack n play" by our kids. Just fold in legs and pull it all toward the middle. Done! I will add that we are in our 60's with arthritis, so ease of use was important!
customer_reviews.author: jakeswife

customer_reviews.title: Perfect tent
customer_reviews.text: We are lifelong campers. I’ve been through so many tents before. This is the best tent I’ve ever come across. It’s big and roomy. It rained for two days straight on our last camping trip, and this tent right here was a warrior. Not one leak, great airflow even with all the windows closed. And my husband put the tent up and down by himself without any issues. If you are looking for a hassle free, large waterproof tent, this is it.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Awesome tent!
customer_reviews.text: It really did take just a minute or two to setup (not including the anchors) Used it once, holds up fine, I don't see any potential issues so far. Having openings would have been nice on 2 ends of the tent since a few went to sleep early and it would have been nice to open the tent at the opposite end to where they were sleeping instead of stepping over them. Otherwise lived it! Will be going camping this weekend with just 4 people but this tent is so much easier to setup i'll probably bring it instead of my usual 4 person tent.
customer_reviews.author: Scray

customer_reviews.title: Easy, waterproof, roomy
customer_reviews.text: Took this tent camping on a stormy, wet 4th of July weekend. Just me and the hubby and our two pitbulls. We were so comfortable inside this tent and had so much room, it was great. Even though it was storming like crazy outside, we stayed perfectly dry inside. Not to mention it was a breeze to put up! Worth it for sure!
customer_reviews.author: Cole

customer_reviews.title: Decent Product - Better Customer Service.
customer_reviews.text: I reached out to Core customer service today after having this tent for one year. Was only used twice and it tore at the seam. They were able to verify my order and said they can offer me a one time no charge replacement. Could not be happier with this company that stands behind the product. Other than this one issue, we love our tent!
customer_reviews.author: Darlene

customer_reviews.title: Jiff to put up.
customer_reviews.text: Haven't used it yet. Going camping next weekend. We have ab5th wheel and I dont like taking it out on my own. So i am giving a wack at tent camping. Glamping. Got all the comfort items. So boxed great. Went up by myself 12 minutes no staking down and packed in same time. Bery spacious. Didnt realize it was only screen on top but Ok with Rain fly. I mighe be liking this. More sgort jaunts ahead. Neill update agter use.
customer_reviews.author: CC

customer_reviews.title: Love this tent.  Roomy and So Well Made
customer_reviews.text: Love Love Love. This was the easiest tent I have ever used. It was in place literally within a minute. We were staying at close to 11,000 ft and this tent sustained a period of high wind and a heavy rain. There wasn’t a single drop of water in the living space and it was a stable as can be. Speaking of living space there was room for 3 cots, chair and small table plus all of our backpacks and gear. Couldn’t be happier.
customer_reviews.author: JudithM

customer_reviews.title: Best tent I've ever owned!
customer_reviews.text: This tent exceeded my expectations. I have been camping for over 30 years and have never experienced a tent so easy to put up and take down. When my husband purchased this tent, we wanted a tent that was easy to set up. I took the 90 seconds set up time with a grain of salt, expecting it to take at least 5 minutes: especially as a first timer. I honestly think it took less than 90 seconds! We don't typically camp in extreme climate/weather so this tent works perfectly for us. If you are looking for a tent to stay insulated, this would not be the tent for you. Was exactly what we hoped it would be 10/10!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: We love this tent. It is perfect for our family. My husband is 6'5" and this tent is roomy enough for him to stand up and not feel cramped. The netting and airflow allowed our baby girl to take naps during the hot day without a problem. We hung a battery operated fan in the center of the tent to help with circulation during the hot days. During our last camping trip, we had a large rain-wind storm and the tent held up wonderfully. We couldn't be happier with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy

customer_reviews.title: Easily fits full size Harley! With plenty of room to spare!
customer_reviews.text: Great tent! Massive and severe thunderstorm just came through. Half the guys in my group lost their tents. And 2 of the canopy e-z ups were completely destroyed. I on the other hand was cozy and completely dry. Tent never even batted an eye. 6’4” here and it is very comfortable and easy to stand up in. Super fast set up. I did it by myself in under 5 minutes. Best part? I can park my motorcycle inside overnight with plenty of room to still move around.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Turner

customer_reviews.title: Super Easy set up.
customer_reviews.text: This was the easiest tent to set up ever. My son and I had it up in a few minutes. Amazing. We have especially enjoyed all of the windows and being able to leave the rain covering off at night to see the stars and allow the air to flow through. Sleeping 9 people all depends on their size. We had two queen size air mattresses in them and their was room to move around in the front and one side. I am very happy with the purchase though. Definitely worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy Voorhees

customer_reviews.title: The tarp material for the floor was a very nice touch. This tent sets up in about 2-3 ...
customer_reviews.text: Huge tent, we had a queen air mattress, a 4 ft table, 2 chairs and a dog bed in ours with plenty of space to spare. Managed to put a small rip on the side after the 4th use. The tarp material for the floor was a very nice touch. This tent sets up in about 2-3 minutes(before staking it down) with 2 people. My only issue with it is the zipper on the D door.... it keeps getting stuck on the zipper flap. very annoying. Other than that. It's perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Wei

customer_reviews.title: This tent rocks
customer_reviews.text: Very impressed with how easy it was to set this tent up. It took literally fourty six seconds between my daughter and myself. My wife looked away to put ice in the ice chest and turned around literally with a shocked look on her face to see a tent put up. 👍 GG
customer_reviews.author: Mendo View

customer_reviews.title: Good tent
customer_reviews.text: Only used it once so far but it preformed well. I was able to put it up and take it down by myself will very little struggle the first time. After that there is nothing to it. I actually had to put it up in the rain the first time and outside of what got in before we got the rain fly on it stayed completely dry. It is a bit heavy tough around but that is a small price considering the ease of use and set up.
customer_reviews.author: M1A1CMDR

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: We had the core 10 straight wall and loved it but the roof pole broke so had to return it. We replaced it with this one thinking to cut down time setting up and i will say the good news is it definitely was easy to set up. Best set up and take down ever. The problem.... it leaked alot! We ended up getting out of our beds and running out to set up a tarp over the tent. My kids beds were wet. Very disappointing and unexpected as our other core didn't leak.
customer_reviews.author: Kaye

customer_reviews.title: Not for cold or windy weather.
customer_reviews.text: Let me start by saying this tent is very, very nice. Setup and takedown is fast and easy, and there is plenty of room. A couple of things to note: First, don’t stake it too taught or the door zippers will hang up. Second, this tent has vents galore, but the bottom vent that’s designed to draw air in and up (cooling the tent) can be cinched but not zippered. Because of this, a stiff breeze of more than 10 mph goes right through. That’s tough on cold nights when just blocking wind makes a big difference. I’d still buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Happy so far
customer_reviews.text: Only used one trip for 4 nights. Easy to open, great venting, seems sturdy so far. We used on a windy beach site and held up well however I did use sand tent spikes instead of ones provided. We had 3 twin air mattresses and it was still roomy. Only a light rain while we camped so not a good test of water resistance but I usually spray the seams anyway. Using again this weekend in a wooded area. Will update if anything changes .
customer_reviews.author: Mar

customer_reviews.title: 1.5 year report
customer_reviews.text: Gone a quite a few camping trips now with it over two summers and so far we've been pleased. Very east to setup and take down, overall pretty lightweight for its capacity, and materials are not too bad. Only thing think could be better are zippers to the door. It works, but at times, you have to be kind of delicate with it or it will tug or snag. Never camped this in the rain so not sure how waterproof but no tents never truly are so if it ever pours, I recommend setting up a tarp over the rain fly for added insurance.
customer_reviews.author: TS

customer_reviews.title: Very well engineered, great price
customer_reviews.text: This tent was a great purchase. I have taken it beach camping twice now. The tent is well made and withstood both heavy thunderstorm rains and strong winds. It is possible for one person to put it up and take it down, but it is easier with two people. The floor is a study tarp-like material and all of the seams appear strong. I've had no issues with the zippers or pockets. I put a tarp under the tent to help protect the floor but I don't know that it's necessary. Overall, this tent was very well engineered and a great deal for the price.

customer_reviews.title: Great design and functionality.
customer_reviews.text: I have only set this tent up in the backyard to see if I could do it by myself. I did need a little help at the end to lift the corners to full height. However, I did put the rain fly in place before this step so l could easily reach it it; this may have made the last step more difficult. I am 65 and not very strong any longer. But I believe that if it isn’t too windy, I will be able to set this tent up by myself with only a few grunts st the end. Great design and worth the extra money up front to make every set-up easier and quicker.
customer_reviews.author: meR (Great Falls)

customer_reviews.title: Easiest Tent I've Owned
customer_reviews.text: This is a great tent. I got it to replace two others that I've had for a while and really wanted something easy. I used it within a day of receiving it and it took no more than 5 minutes to set-up with the help of one other person - and that was in the rain. Really simple design, spacious (fit two queen size air mattresses with plenty of space for moving around and bags). I would have given this 5 stars except that the rain cover doesn't come out quite far enough to divert drippings from the windows so those remained mostly closed throughout the night. That being said we didn't get any water. Happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Charlie Moore-Ward

customer_reviews.title: Tent collapsed & broke in storm
customer_reviews.text: I was initially happy with this tent as it was very easy to set up and had plenty of room for me and my family inside. However, the tent did NOT hold up in a thunderstorm with rain and wind. The entire tent collapsed on us and the poles snapped in half. This was our first tome using it camping and now it’s completely demolished and unusable. A waste of $200. Save your money and get a dome tent or something that can handle some weather.
customer_reviews.author: Ship8995

customer_reviews.title: Could not stand up to any wind
customer_reviews.text: Used this on two camping trips and seemed ok the first trip, though it collapsed a coupke times for seemingly no reason. Stakes are flimsy and bend if you blow on them. Collapsed in wind/rain on our second trip - two poles snapped at the hub and the jagged end on one broken pole tore the rain fly to shreds. Thankfully it was daytime and we weren't inside it. We will be looking for something a bit more sturdy in our next tent.
customer_reviews.author: A mom

customer_reviews.title: Really does only take 3 minutes to put up!
customer_reviews.text: Man, where were these tents when I was younger?? It really does take less than 3 minutes to put up. (practice once before your trip) It took me longer to secure the guy lines etc than it did to erect. Take down was just as easy. The tent is roomy for a family of 4, which was really nice. We had a queen airbed on my side and 2 bags on the other with plenty of room to spare. Only reason for the 4 stars instead of 5 is I'm not 100% convinced this tent would survive a moderate windstorm.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: "fer campin in the outdoors!
customer_reviews.text: We went camping for the first time in a while so we bought this tent. It went up fast, it impressed our other campers enough that they will be buying a similar tent. Only drawback that I saw was one of the other campers their tent door could actually become a door. You could make it rigid with graphite poles and it would open and close like a door, no need to unzip then zip, forgot your keys, unzip then rezip, oh wait I need my wallet too, unzip, rezip. So time consuming. If this thing had a real door like the other tent it would get a 5 star.
customer_reviews.author: Murphy the Dog

customer_reviews.title: It went up pretty quick, since you have to include the fly ...
customer_reviews.text: It went up pretty quick, since you have to include the fly (seriously you really aren't going to go open air at a camp site), more like 5-6 minutes total. We had some strong wind and rain and honestly, not a drop of water came in. I didn't give 5 stars because the zipper systems still gets caught a bit like every other tent out there and too much heat is released through the sides of the tent. If it's below 60, you'll want to bring in a plug in heater if you have an outlet for it. All in all, I would buy this again. Might get the big 10'x18' tent next!!!
customer_reviews.author: J G

customer_reviews.title: SIXTY SECONDS
customer_reviews.text: I don’t care if the rent is durable or not. I don’t care if I have to buy another one in few years. (For the record, the durability seems fine). This genius of a tent literally takes sixty seconds to set up. SIXTY SECONDS! What is your time and emotional energy worth to you? My camp fire is going, steak is getting to room temp, kids are playing, and I’m on my second beer when all my friend are still fumbling with their poles. Just buy it. It’s with the extra $100 or so.
customer_reviews.author: Jason M

customer_reviews.title: This is a great tent. Very well made
customer_reviews.text: This is a great tent. Very well made. Fits 2 queen double-stack air mattresses with plenty of room in between. Front panel zips completely open so you can come in and out freely. My only gripe is the half circle door, that you wind up using the most has a weird zipper configuration where it always feels like you're pulling or tugging the zipper forcefully to open or close. Might just be a bad zipper. Everything else about the tent is great. Easy to setup and tear down. Surprise, you don't have to struggle to get it back into it's own storage bag.
customer_reviews.author: Porter

customer_reviews.title: Amazed
customer_reviews.text: First of all I have not used this tent outdoors as of yet so cannot attest to its durability. I did however erect it in my living room the day it came in, just to practice with it before my kids camping trip. I was floored at how easy it was to put it up. Not including the fly or staking it down to my stone floors it took less than 2 minutes to put up by myself, with never having looked at the directions. It this tent holds up as well as it's thought out I will never buy another brand, period..
customer_reviews.author: Mike V

customer_reviews.title: large, but very easy to set up.
customer_reviews.text: huge tent - the condo. great for two cots, chairs and table. tall enough for standing. easy to set up and take down. we are old folks and like all the comforts of home, this tent allows it. It is not for extremely cold weather since the roof is mesh and there are two air vents at the bottom. with all ropes stakes down it held up thru high winds, especially once we opened the windows to let the air blow thru. One person can set it up, but it is much faster with two. 9 person? rolled up like sardines.
customer_reviews.author: Gourtrude

customer_reviews.title: Very Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I loved this tent at first it is very roomy and easy to put up. It did very well in the one rain storm I used it in. Today when I went to put it up for only like the 5th time one of the poles split almost all the way off near the knuckle on top of the tent. If it even lasts the rest of this trip it will certainly be the last one. I was hoping this tent would last me a lot longer than it did.
customer_reviews.author: bonnylene

customer_reviews.title: I'm 5'3" and Setup/Broke Down Alone!
customer_reviews.text: This tent is extremely spacious and easy to setup and take down. I was on the hunt for a big tent for a family of 5, but wanted to make sure that I could take my three kids alone in case my husband couldn't get the time off from work. I was able to setup this tent almost completely alone - except for getting the rain fly on. Next time I'll put it on before extending the poles. Watching the assembly video before setting up, made it a breeze. My husband is 6'2", and he can stand up in the tent without hitting his head - he was very very happy. Great tent!!
customer_reviews.author: LG

customer_reviews.title: This is the tent! Roomy and quick set up!
customer_reviews.text: I disperse camp and we found a spot in the mountains after about 2 hours. The sun had set and it was dark. First time setting the tent up, in the dark and it took about 2 minutes to set up. I am so glad I upgraded my tent and went with this. Beyond pleased. Roomy too!
customer_reviews.author: Sparkle

customer_reviews.title: Super Easy Set up/Take down
customer_reviews.text: We've used this tent on 2 trips so far and can't wait to use it again. Can't beat how easy it is to set up and take down. Plus it is super roomy. We had a queen size air mattress on one side and a child's cot on the other with a ton of extra room left. It stormed real bad the first night we used it and everything was still dry in the morning. Highly recommend this tent!
customer_reviews.author: Shannon Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Best Tent We've Ever Owned
customer_reviews.text: No joke, this tent literally goes up in 60 seconds. Standing room and plenty of space for our queen air mattress and all of our camping necessities. Also, rain does not seep through the material like with most tents these days. Everywhere we go with it people are always impressed with how fast it goes up, how big it actually is and the quality for the price 👍🏻
customer_reviews.author: KnowOne

customer_reviews.title: It's amazing!
customer_reviews.text: I am a 5 foot 3 inch woman. I set this up by myself and with no trouble. Counting unboxing, it might have taken about 10 mins, not even. It was amazingly simple! I was worried that taking it down would be challenging, but it was even easier. I also like the fact that the bag that the tent fits into is large. I did not have any trouble putting it away, unlike other tents that I have owned. I am very happy with my purchase. My family will get a lot of use out of this tent.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda M. Gooley

customer_reviews.title: Easy-Up, Roomy & Airy!
customer_reviews.text: Great tent. Easy to put up. I almost did it by myself the first time I put it up. Got the legs tangled and had to have help but I am sure I can put it up and tear it down by myself next time. Very roomy with lots of headroom. Could easily fit 2 queen air mattresses with room to spare. The multiple windows and mesh ceiling make it airy. Even with the windows closed during a rain storm I didn't feel suffocated. All in All a great tent and a great purchase. I will definitely be getting another core tent when this one wears out.
customer_reviews.author: Natalie Rose

customer_reviews.title: Awesome tent!
customer_reviews.text: Really great tent. Easy to set up, plenty of room. Doesn't seem to get wet on the inside even with morning dew. The straight walls mean you don't lose stuff on the sides of the tent, and you can easily stand up almost anywhere inside of this tent. The tent is very easy to take down and pack away as well. Best tent I've ever had. So impressed.
customer_reviews.author: ken.M1

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy material - Tore during first use.  Quite heavy.
customer_reviews.text: Good size and price, but the material tore the first time we used the tent, so we are not able to use one of the two doors. Tent is surprisingly heavy, but that is to be expected for a self-expanding tent. Door zippers do not work smoothly; they catch easily on the tent material and always catch at the half-way point. I would not purchase this tent again, but it is adequate for occasional use, and I'll be able to use it a few more times before replacing it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Tent Mansion
customer_reviews.text: I feel like the king of the woods every time I pop this sucker up. It's just for my wife and I because we like to stretch out when we pitch our tent. It takes virtually no time for my wife and I to set this up even though she's hardly doing any of the work. People were complaining about the wind knocking the tent over...just tie down the ropes dummy.
customer_reviews.author: Uri and Jessi

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to setup and breakdown
customer_reviews.text: Core 9 person Instant Cabin tent takes about 6-8 minutes to setup once you have done it a few times. Its a good summer tent for light weather camping or just an easy option for backyard shelter or a day at the park. Iʻm giving it 4 stars because I wish the roof of the tent was more than just a screen - that is the weakest part of the construction and if it gets damaged its hard to patch. The rain/weather guard is easy to install over the tent.
customer_reviews.author: Kailua808

customer_reviews.title: Lasted 4 months
customer_reviews.text: It was super easy to set up, kept the weather out extremely well and serious rainstorms didn’t put a drop inside. Unfortunately, it is made from very thin flimsy material that breaks down quickly. After 4 months, waking up meant new tears in the fabric from nothing at all. The tent now resides in the Dump. Quite an expense for such low quality fabric.
customer_reviews.author: Jane E.

customer_reviews.title: Great tent
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic tent starting with the fact it sets up in about 10-15 minutes. Tall enough you can stand up inside, lots of thoughtful pockets and hooks for phones/lanterns. Room divider is flimsy but gives you a modicum of privacy. Materials and stitching appear to be sturdy. Zippers snag a little but about what should be expected. Folds back down pretty easily. Tight fit to get it back into the storage bag, but very do-able. Overall, a great tent.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love it. 60 seconds or less set up
customer_reviews.text: Thank to the guy that tried multiple tents and wrote a lengthy review on here. You led to me purchasing this. The 1st weekend and this past weekend of Ren Fest there were high winds. Our tent barely budged while others were literally rolling across the fields. Condensation does find it's way in, but not too badly. Oh and the zipper gets stuck a little, but just hold it taut and go slow. Goes up in less than 60 seconds without the weather cover. Overall 10/10 would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Nia Jenkins

product_meta.title: CORE 9 Person Instant Cabin Tent - 14' x 9'
feature_bullets: Instant 60 Second Setup; Sleeps 9 people; Fits two queen air mattresses; Center Height:78
CORE H20 Block Technology and adjustable ground vent
Features room divider and wall storage pockets keep items neat and off the tent floor
Electrical cord access port (port is fully closable when not in use)
Includes rain fly, tent stakes, and carry bag
